meanings.definition: relating to or situated near the tail
meanings.sent1: The cercal fin helps the fish steer in the water.
meanings.sent2: The cercal feathers of the bird were beautifully colored.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its cercal tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The cercal markings on the butterfly's wings resembled eyes.
meanings.sent5: The cercal stripe on the caterpillar was a bright yellow.

meanings.definition: a sensory appendage on the rear of an insect
meanings.sent1: The cricket used its cercal to sense vibrations in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The cercal of the cockroach helps it navigate in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The ant joked that its cercal was its 'antenna to the world'.
meanings.sent4: The spider's cercal twitched as it detected prey nearby.
meanings.sent5: The beetle's cercal was as sensitive as a tiny radar.
